properties.name: Alamo in Pee Wee's Big Adventure
properties.description: Posted by HundredflowersSan Antonio, Texas, USAExterior shots of the Alamo for Pee-Wee\'s Big Adventure.

properties.name: Alhambra Farmers' Market
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  S Monterey St & E Bay State St, Alhambra, CA 91801Day: Sunday Hours: 8:30 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. Location: Monterey & E. Bay State Street City: Alhambra County: Los Angeles Manager: Harry C. Wong Office Address: 111 S. First St., Alhambra, CA 91801 Phone: 626-570-5081

properties.name: Ambassador Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers 3400 Wilshire Boulevard, Los Angeles, CAThis was the playground of the Hollywood elite, before Beverly Hills became a major nesting ground. Despite all of its celebrated history & past glory days, the Ambassador Hotel will forever be remembered & associated with the assassination of Robert F Kennedy, brother of President John F Kennedy, who had himself been assassinated in Dallas in 1963. Senator Robert F Kennedy was himself running for the Presidency in 1968. He had just finished delivering his victory speech for the Californian Primary, in the Hotel\'s Embassy Ballroom , when on leaving through the pantry he was gunned down by a man named Sirhan Sirhan. The Ambassador Hotel has been used as a filming location for many years since its close and was just recently partially demolished after a heated and controversial debate over the issue of historical preservation. It\'s going to be a school I believe. In the movie LA Story, the hotel is used as the location for L\'Idiot, the fancy restaurant that Harris K Telemacher struggles to get a reservation at. When I was a little girl I used to take tennis lessons in the tennis courts of the closed down hotel. My aunt would pick me up from lessons and she\'d always shake her head and say "poor bobby, bobby kennedy, what a shame."

properties.name: Angel Oak Tree ~1400 Years Old
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers3688 Angel Oak Rd. Johns Island, SCThe Angel Oak is a Southern live oak tree located in Angel Oak Park, on Johns Island, South Carolina. It is estimated to be over 1400 years old, standing 20 m (65 feet) tall, 2.47 m in diameter, and the crown covers an area of 1,580 m2 (17,000 square feet). Its longest limb is 27 m (89 feet) in length. The tree and surrounding park have been owned by the neighboring city of Charleston since 1991.

properties.name: Artesian Well
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers4th Ave and Adams, olympia, waYou might never notice it, except for the steady flow of visitors pulling up to fill empty jugs and jars. A pipe, sticking out of the ground in the back of the Diamond parking lot? Yes, it\'s the Olmpia Artesian well. Fresh, cold water that refreshes you. I hear there is talk of moving it?

properties.name: Atwater Village Farmers' Market
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  3250 Glendale Blvd, los angeles, caThe Atwater Village Farmers\' Market features 12 farmers and 7 food vendors who bring a diverse selection of fresh fruits and vegetables as well as spices, sprouts, spreads, breads, meat, nuts, sweets and flowers each week. The market also hosts monthly events including cooking demonstrations, tastings, contests, children\'s activities and live entertainment. The Atwater Village market is open year round and serves the surrounding communities of Silverlake, Los Feliz, Glendale and Glassell Park. The market is located at 3250 Glendale Blvd., in the Wells Fargo Bank parking lot at Larga Ave. Day: Sunday Hours: 10:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m.

properties.name: Behind The Post Office
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers801 f. street san, diegoThis now defunct store in Downtown San Diego still has a branch located in San Francisco but in the early 90s it was a cultural space to graffiti artists, collectors of Kicks and Acid Jazz Heads. It was not uncommon for Twist to do a mural on the exterior while DJ Greyboy spun records inside. Early instore appearances by Wu Tang pre-enter the 36 chambers release, early bizarre ride Pharcyde and Del pre-no need for alarm were just a few of the people that graced the store before they reached superstardom. Sundays were especially chill here. I will always miss this place. Owner Michael Pringle also did Greed clothing and 432f tradeshow.

properties.name: Bellflower Farmers' Market
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  Oak Street and Clark Avenue, bellflower, ca Monday from 9:00 AM to 1:00 PM

properties.name: Bergamot Station
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers   2525 Michigan Ave., Santa Monica, caBergamot Station is a complex of galleries as well as a little cafe and Hiromi International Paper Store, one of the best paper stores I\'ve ever seen! Once a train depot for the now-defunct Red Line trolley, this warehouse complex houses more than 30 art galleries and the Santa Monica Museum of Art.

properties.name: Best Panhandler Ever
properties.description: Posted by HundredflowersMany visitors to the Fisherman\'s Wharf have fallen prey to the most bizarre panhandlers I have ever seen. It\'s actually a team of panhandlers. One of the guys will catch folks\' attention by saying something to the effect of "psst" or "hey." Of course, human nature being what it is, people will look at him and try to figure out what is up. What they don\'t notice is his partner hiding behind the bushes, who takes the opportunity to jump out yelling something to the effect of "BOO!" and totally scaring the pants off of people. Then both men will bow and present their hats for a tip or some change. It\'s is totally amazing and bizarre and somehow it works thought I can\'t put my finger on why.

properties.name: Beverly Hills Farmers Market
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  9300 Civic Center Drive, beverly hills, caThe Beverly Hills Farmers\' Market is a weekly outdoor certified market which provides the community with the finest of California-grown, fresh and seasonal fruits and vegetables, juices, breads, specialty items and more in a festive outdoor street setting. Sunday 9:00 AM 1:00 PM

properties.name: Bike Accident When I was 9
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers 107 s citrus ave, los angeles, caI was riding around the block on my pink Diamond Back bmx when a car zooming out of a driveway backed into me, sending me careening into another car that was reversing out of the driveway next to it. I was thrown to the ground and bounced a few feet but found myself without a scratch. My bicycle was pinned under the second car. It seemed that the two old men involved were on their way to play some golf together and had been in a hurry. They were pretty freaked out about it and after making sure I wasn\'t hurt, pried my bike out for me. It was in ok condition too. I was terrified and shaking, thinking that since I had been in a car crash that the men might "sue me." After shouting thanks for helping me retreive my bike, I sped off in fear that they might pursue me to try to find out who I was for their impending lawsuit.

properties.name: Brentwood Farmers Market
properties.description: Posted by HundredflowersS Gretna Green Way & San Vicente Blvd, Brentwood, CA 90049Brentwood Farmers Market, Sunday, 9:00 AM-1:00 PM

properties.name: Center for Land Use Interpretation
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers9331 Venice Blvd., culver city, los angelesThe Center for Land Use Interpretation is a research organization involved in exploring, examining, and understanding land and landscape issues. The Center employs a variety of methods to pursue its mission - engaging in research, classification, extrapolation, and exhibition.

properties.name: Central Ave Farmers Market
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  E 43rd St & S Central Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90011The Central Avenue Farmers\' Market is a mini-certified farmers\' market featuring 5 to 7 farmers who sell a variety of fruits and vegetables as well as nuts and dried fruits. In addition to a great selection of fresh produce, the market hosts events for children and adults including healthy cooking demonstrations, tastings, a salsa contest, Spring into Health activities, free raffles, live music, craft workshops and pumpkin carving for kids. The market is open year round and is located at Central Avenue and 43rd Street. The Central Avenue market proudly accepts EBT/Foodstamps and WIC/Senior FMNP coupons. Saturday, 9:00 AM to 1:00 PM.

properties.name: Chatsworth Farmers Market
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers Devonshire St & Topanga Canyon Blvd, Chatsworth, caDay: Saturday Hours: 8:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. Location: MetroLink Train Station Parking Lot off Devonshire St, between Topanga Canyon Blvd and Canoga Ave

properties.name: Chinatown Farmers Market
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  727 N. Hill st, los angeles, caThursday, 4:00 PM to 8:00 PM. On Thursday, May 16, 2002, Chinatown became the first multicultural district in the Los Angeles area to host a farmers\' market. And this farmers\' market is unlike any other in the region. While it features quality produce from certified growers and producers in Southern California, it also offers a tremendous selection of Asian produce.

properties.name: Dinosaurs from Pee Wees Big Adventure
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers 50800 Seminole Dr, Cabazon, CA 92230-2304This is the location of the famous dinosaurs that Pee Wee and Simone sit inside of in Pee Wee\'s Big Adventure. They watch the sun rise and talk about Simone\'s "big but." You can\'t go inside the T-Rex but you can go inside the brontosaurus gift shop. The diner that Simone works in is right next door.

properties.name: Donald E. Bianchi Planetarium at Cal State Northridge Planetarium
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers18111 Nordhoff Street, Northridge, California 91330-8268Located on the CSUN campus within the complex of Science Buildings, adjacent to the building formerly known as Science Building 3, now Citrus Hall, the Donald E. Bianchi Planetarium (shown in the accompanying photo) provides weekly star shows and other programs not only for CSUN students but also for the many communities of the San Fernando Valley and surrounding areas.

properties.name: Downbeat Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers   1200 n alvarado, los angeles, caA nice coffee shop independently owned (meaning not a stupid chain coffee shop!) with great coffee and the best baked goods. A small but robust menu of lunchy and dinner things. Live music some nights (jazz of course).

properties.name: Eaton Canyon Natural Area
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  1750 North Altadena Drive Pasadena, California 91107Eaton Canyon lies nestled in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains, very close to Los Angeles and Pasadena. There are bicycle and foot trails, as well as a nature center that coordinates outdoor planned activities. I love the dioramas in the nature center. There\'s a beautiful waterfall that feeds a stream that winds its way through the park. Lot\'s of folks take their very happy dogs there and you\'ll see a lot of families out enjoying the more moderate trails.

properties.name: Echo Park Boat House
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  During the day you can rent glitter covered paddle boats to take out on the lake.

properties.name: Echo Park Film Center aka La Famiglia
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers 1200 N alvarado, los angeles, caEcho Park Film Center is a volunteer-run, non-profit media arts organization located in the Echo Park neighborhood of Los Angeles. We provide equal and affordable access to film/video education and resources via: a community microcinema and meeting space free and nominal cost media arts education programs a comprehensive small format film equipment and service department a touring film festival showcasing local established and student filmmakers Be part of the EPFC Family! Come watch a movie, take a filmmaking class, rent a projector, telecine your home movies, check out our extensive film and book lending library, submit your film for programming, buy some Super 8 film, sign up for a membership or just drop by and say hello!

properties.name: El Camino College Planetarium
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers16007 Crenshaw Blvd. Torrance, CA 90506In the spring of 2005 the El Camino Planetarium installed a new GOTO Chronos planetarium projector with new star plate technology that projects 8,500 stars (down to magnitude 6.5), planets and even the Milky Way. Thirteen of the brightest stars in the sky are projected in their natural colors. In addition to stars, the Chronos projector can accurately display 26 of the most popular celestial objects like the Adromeda Galaxy and the Orion Nebula with dedicated projectors for the Magellanic clouds. The Astronomy Department holds planetarium shows several times each semester. To find out the current planetarium show schedule or to arrange a private show for schools or clubs, call (310) 660-3373 or 660-3245.

properties.name: El Segundo Farmers Market
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  East Grand Avenue & Eucalyptus Drive, el segundo, caThursday, 3:00 PM to 7:00 PM

properties.name: Ellwood Mesa
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers isla vista, caEllwood Mesa is a spectacular coastal treasure. It is home to a variety of flora and fauna, as well as some 60,000 migratory butterflies. It\'s also a sanctuary for hikers, joggers, birders, artists, and families. Its protection took a concerted effort by the local community, the Trust for Public Land, Friends of the Ellwood Coast, the City of Goleta, private donors nationwide, and dedicated supporters at the local, state, and federal government levels. After nearly 30 years of hard work, the Trust for Public Land is pleased to announce that this cherished community asset is safe from residential development. When I was in school, I would come here often to wander through the eucaplyptus groves, watch the monarchs and wander to the beach.

properties.name: Encino Farmers Market
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  Victory Blvd & White Oak, encino, caThe market is open year round on Sundays from 8:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m. at 17400 Victory Blvd. (between White Oak and Balboa) with plenty of convenient parking.

properties.name: Encino Velodrome
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers 17301 Oxnard, Encino, CASmall velodrome in Encino. They have classes here and bikes for rent. Outdoors.

properties.name: Escape Room RIP
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers4083 W. Third St., los angeles, caA Koreatown dive bar. A haunt. A great juke box and hot dogs in a pressure cooker. The dartboard was the best. One time I danced with an old man who had his oxygen tank with him. Always lots of older folks mixed in with who knows. Escape to or from? RIP.

properties.name: Fingerprints lps and cds
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers 4612 E 2nd St, long beach, caAn indie record shop with a decent selection. I stop by from time to time and they always have what I\'m looking for. A good used selection too. They also sell dvds.

properties.name: Frank N Hanks
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers 518 S Western Ave, Los Angeles, CADIVE BAR. This is a dive bar in koreatown. Dart board but good luck finding darts that aren\'t bent all to hell. Once I saw a drunk thrown out on his ear, in the process of being ejected he somehow lost his pants and his sandals. Out on the street he tried to fight an old man that looked like Popeye. James tried to stop the fight by throwing one of the lost sandals at the drunk\'s head. Popeye took advantage of the distraction and punched the drunk man in the head.

properties.name: Galco's Soda Pop Stop
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers 5702 York Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA 90042From the outside it looks like a mom and pop grocery store. Inside, you\'ll find hundreds of kinds of rare, unusual and "old time" sodas. There\'s also a pretty decent beer/liquor selection, old time candy section and a sandwich counter in the back. I want to keep a journal to keep all the sodas I\'ve tried straight in my head. In root beers alone there seem to be hundreds of brands.

properties.name: Gardena Saturday Farmers Market
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers Van Ness Avenue & West El Segundo Blvd, gardena, caSaturday, 6:30 AM to Noon

properties.name: Gardena Wed Farmers Market
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  1670 W. 162nd st, gardena, caWednesday, 7:30 AM to Noon

properties.name: Gelato Vera Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  3753 India Street, San Diego, CA 92103This Cafe is a San Diego independent classic. Look for shows and other interesting events plus damn fine coffee and Gelato. A good place to just relax with an Endoresque upstairs.

properties.name: Glendale Farmers Market
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  N Brand Blvd & E Wilson Ave, Glendale, CA 91203Thursday, 9:30 AM to 1:00 PM

properties.name: Glenn Danzig's House
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  franklin ave, los angeles, caI\'m not dropping any bombs by mapping out the sacred crypt of Glenn Danzig, it\'s been a Los Angeles inside joke for a long time. I could put the street address but I\'ll leave it up to explorers to search it out in this general vicinity. You\'ll know when you\'ve found it either by a) the giant pile of bricks stacked in the front yard or b) faithful legions of cape wearing, devil lock sporting goth kids posing in front and hoping to catch of glimpse of the dark one hosing off his Jaguar in the driveway.

properties.name: Grand Central Market
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  317 S. Broadway, los angeles, caSince 1917 the Grand Central Market has been a bustling marketplace, packed with any kind of vendor you can imagine. Fruits, veggies, herbs, meat, seafood, ice cream, juices, mexican food, chinese food, baked goods and even a bar! There\'s sawdust on the floor and you have to fight to get a seat. I love going here on a hot day for some ice cream--or if I feel like playing with fire I\'ll go for a plate of oysters on the half shell sitting on a bed of crushed ice. (I haven\'t gotten sick yet.) Mmm, makes my mouth water just thinking about it!

properties.name: Griffith Observatory
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  2800 East Observatory Road, Los Angeles, CA 90027-1255 USAThe classic Griffith Observatory and its grounds are closed to the public for an extensive renovation. Public operations continue at the Griffith Observatory Satellite -- the Observatory\'s temporary home during construction -- in the northeast corner of Griffith Park. Supposedly, the classic Observatory will reopen in the second half of 2006. This is where the knife fight scene from Rebel Without a Cause was filmed. Hopefully they\'re keeping the bronze bust of James Dean as they renovate. This used to have the same magical quality of the Natural History Museum--storehouse of elaborate dioramas made before you were born, seeminly enchanted with some permanent sense of optimism. We\'ll see what the renovation brings later this year. There was an great planetarium show here and hopefully they\'ll continue showings when they re-open.

properties.name: HOME BASE @ Dodger Stadium
properties.description: Posted by HundredflowersHome base at Dodger Stadium. Chavez Ravine, where this stadium is now used to be a vibrant latino community. They booted families out of there to put in the stadium. A place with a lot of history. I like to go there and get the tickets, puts you on the top deck with a nice view of the remaining ravine.

properties.name: Hermosa Beach Farmers Market
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers    N Valley Dr & 10th Pl, Manhattan Beach, CA 90266Fridays, 12:00 PM to 4:00 PM

properties.name: Hidden Trolley Car
properties.description: Posted by HundredflowersIt\'s in plain view yet no one notices it, an old red line trolley car stashed under an overhang and set back from the street. It\'s behind a fence but if you look for it you can see it.

properties.name: Hiromi Paper International
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers2525 Michigan Ave Unit G-9 Santa Monica, CA 90404Located in Santa Monica\'s Bergamot Station Arts Complex, Hiromi Paper offers a jaw dropping selection of high quality papers. They also sell paper on-line through their website.

properties.name: Hollywood Farmers Market
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  Ivar Ave & Selma Ave, Hollywood, CA 90028Sunday, 8:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. Limited free parking available in the Doolittle Theatre parking lot at 1623 N. Vine Street from 8 am– 1 pm. Additional parking available at Sunset+Vine (Borders/Bed, Bath & Beyond). Enter on Morningside Drive, just west of the intersection of Sunset & Vine. 1 Hour free with market validation or from 8 am-2 pm.

properties.name: Hollywood Forever Cemetary
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers 6000 Santa Monica Blvd., los angeles, caLos Angeles goths have long known Hollywood Forever as the final resting place of Rozz Williams of Christian Death. You will also find luminaries like Johnny Ramone, Rudoph Valentino, Douglas Fairbanks and thousands of actors and hollywood fixtures. In the summer they do an outdoor movie series that is really popular but I don\'t know the name.

properties.name: Hollywood Sears Farmers Market
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  5601 Santa Monica Blvd, los angeles, caWednesday, 12:30 PM to 5:30 PM

properties.name: House of Pies
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  1869 N Vermont Ave, los angeles, caThe food isn\'t that great but it\'s a nice place to go for a late night slice of pie. There\'s a good variety! It\'s one of the few areas in the neighborhood that has its own parking lot. Good for those night when you need to do some soul searching over a coconut cream pie. Mon-Thu 6:30am-1pm Fri-Sat 6:30am-2am Sun 6:30am-1am (323) 666-9961

properties.name: Huntington Park Farmers Market
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers    Bissell St & E Florence Ave, Huntington Park, CA 90255Wednesday 9:30 AM to 1:00 PM in Salt Lake Park

properties.name: Imix Bookstore
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  4052 eagle rock blvd, los angeles, caSocially conscious books, art and gift items. Independent bookstore!

properties.name: K records
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers 802 Jefferson St. SE, Olympia Wa 98501For many people around the world and in the community of Olympia, K records is a place you have searched out for a long time--maybe in your dreams, maybe before you even knew its name. It\'s that place that you always wished was true. Maybe one day you decided to go looking for it, and here it is just the way you imagined it.

properties.name: KCET (Public TV) - Harris' Station in LA Story
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers4401 Sunset Boulevard, los angeles, ca"That\'s how LA copes with a surprise low of 58 degrees that turned the weekend into a real weenie shrinker." Harris K Telemacher weather forecast in LA Story This is the filming location for the television studio that Harris K Telemacher works at in the movie LA Story by Steve Martin.

properties.name: Kiana's Lodge AKA Great Northern from Twin Peaks
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers 14976 Sandy Hook Rd NE, Poulsbo, WA 98370"Short stack of griddle cakes, maple syrup slightly heated, melted butter, slice of ham... nothing beats the taste sensation when maple syrup collides with ham." FBI Agent Dale Cooper, having breakfast at the Great Northern. You will need to take a ferry to get to Bainsbridge Island, which is where Kiana\'s lodge is located. This is where the interior scenes of the Great Northern were filmed. Also, nearby is the big log where Laura was found wrapped in plastic. This is a wedding/event location, so you want to call ahead to see if there are any events before you try to visit. They probably won\'t let you in if there is something booked.

properties.name: Kind and Generous Moment
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowersvermont ave and beverly blvd, los angeles, ca400,000 thousand people marched down Wilshire Blvd today, May 1st, 2006 to celebrate the contributions that immigrants have brought to the United States and to oppose proposed racist immigration legislation. There were thousands of radiant and hopeful faces, miles and miles of them stretching out into the distance. By the end of the march, I realized that I had missed my opportunity to take the free shuttle back to downtown with an organization that I had marched with. The Metro had also arranged buses to take people to the nearest subway station but you still had to pay the fare. I realized I had no cash on me and a kind man next to me offered to pay my fare. Luckily, the bus driver waved me onto the bus, anxious to drive away from the swelling crowds. When we got to the metro station, I was surprised to see that the subway cops were combing through passengers to ensure they had paid their fares. (After other large protests, I had been waved onto the trains by cops eager to disperse the large crowd.) It was my fault for neglecting to get cash beforehand! I had been in such a hurry to find old friends in this familar activity, the Los Angeles May Day Immigrants Rights March, that I have lovingly participated in for years. Crestfallen and with a long way to go to get home, I turned to go back up to the street level to seek out an atm. Somehow the same man who had offered me a fare for the bus had found me in the subway station. He put his crumpled day-pass in my hand. I asked him if he was done with it and he said he wasn\'t but that he had money to purchase another. It was such a kind and unexpexted thing. I tried to give his pass back with much thanks but he insisted and started to walk away. I chased him and asked him his name, which was Guadalupe. We shook hands and I looked for him on the platform downstairs but he never appeared. I can\'t stop thinking about what a kind and warm moment it was and how this kind of generosity stays with you and rekindles your warmth towards others.

properties.name: LA Adams Vermont Farmers Market
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  1432 W. Adams Blvd, los angeles, caWednesdays 1:00 PM to 6:00 PM, June - August 2:00 PM to 5:00 PM, September - May 1432 W. Adams, St. Agnes Catholic Church

properties.name: LA Eagle Rock Farmers Market
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  2100 Merton Avenue, los angeles, caFriday, 5:00 PM to 8:30 PM

properties.name: LA Harambee Farmers Market
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  Crenshaw Blvd & W Slauson Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90043Saturday, 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM

properties.name: La Cienega Farmers Market
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  South La Cienega Blvd and West 18th Street, los angeles, caThursday, 3:00 PM to 7:00 PM

properties.name: Los Angeles County Museum of Art (LACMA)
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  5905 Wilshire Boulevard, los angeles, caThe Los Angeles County Museum of Art (LACMA)! Explore more than 100,000 works of art at LACMA, the largest encyclopedic museum west of Chicago. Through its far-reaching collections, the museum is both a resource to and a reflection of the many cultural communities and heritages in Southern California. I find the museum kind of cramped and packed in, but they\'ve just started construction of a new building so hopefully that will help. The permanent collection is pretty good and once in a while they have good new exhibitions too. They also have free outdoor jazz performances in the summertime as well as family activities year round. In the movie LA Story, Steve Martin\'s character Harris Telemacher rollerskates through some of the permanent collection.

properties.name: Los Angeles Flower Mart
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers 766 Wall Street, Los Angeles, CaliforniaThe "Wall Street" of flowers. Florists from far and wide gather here at the crack of dawn and bargain for the best flowers. Every kind of plant and flower imaginable can be found here. Non tradespeople can enter as well, but not until after the florists have had their first pick.

properties.name: Lucky Bamboo & Flowers
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers426 E 8TH St, los angeles, ca 90014Many Angelenos know that the best place to go for flowers is the flower district downtown. This is one of the best. This is where knowing moms go to outfit quincenera parties and weddings. It\'s a nice place to people watch.

properties.name: Luna Sol Cafe RIP
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers 2501 W Sixth St, los angeles, caThis used to be a great place where it took forever to get your food but it was good food and everyone knew it was where activists went to meet. I planned many an event while waiting for my potato tacos with spinach. You could also count on running into the right people there. There used to be a little infoshop/bookstore inside too. RIP Luna Sol.

properties.name: M theory music
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers   3004 Juniper Street San Diego, CA 92104This music store has the inside track on San Diego independent music as well as your standard fare. check their site for instores and local events.

properties.name: Machine Project Gallery
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  1200 n alvarado st, los angeles, caExisting to encourage the heroic experiments of the gracefully over-ambitious, Machine Project presents workshops, events, installations and performances on a semi-regular basis.

properties.name: Mamas Hot Tamales
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers 2122 West Seventh Street, los angelesIf you are a foodie or love tamales, get your butt over to Mamas. They have a huge variety of tamales from many different regions that won\'t disappoint. Also, if you are a coffee snob you will love it that there is a roaster on site that really knows his stuff. You can buy coffee by the pound! You will also feel good because you\'ll be supporting a good project--Mama\'s Hot Tamales Café is an apprentice-operated business and job training restaurant that provides hands-on and classroom instruction designed to train low-and-moderate-income vendors in the disciplines necessary to begin a career path toward success in the culinary world.

properties.name: McManus & Morgan Paper Store
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers 2506 W. 7th Street Los Angeles, CA 90057In 1923, two UCLA Students Named John McManus and Elder Morgan got together and decided to open a store. Over the years, this store sold art supplies, offered book-binding services and stocked an incredible array of handmade paper. This legendary downtown treasure, has stocked every type of paper, envelope and invitation accessory imaginable. Located right by MacArthur Park near downtown Los Angeles! An amazing paper store for the kind of person who gets excited about stationary and letterpress and handmade papers.

properties.name: Metro Entertainment (comics)
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers6 West Anapamu, Santa Barbara, CA 93101Website primarily covers their autographed items but it\'s also a comic shop. Lots of superhero/manga but also some indies. For a complete nerd outing, visit the model train shop down the street.

properties.name: Metro: Vermont/Beverly
properties.description: Posted by Generaljohn301 N. Vermont Av. Los Angeles 90004

properties.name: Mission San Fernando Rey (Inside of Alamo in Pee Wee's Big Adventure)
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers15151 San Fernando Mission Boulevard, Mission Hills, Los Angeles, California, USAThe Mission San Fernando Rey serves as the interior of the Alamo in Pee Wee\'s Big Adventure.

properties.name: Mobile T-House Truck
properties.description: Posted by Adventure!

properties.name: Musee Mecanique
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers   Pier 45 Shed A at the end of Taylor Street, Fisherman\'s Wharf, San Francisco, CA The Musee Mecanique is frozen in time. One of the world\'s largest privately owned collections of mechanically operated musical instruments and antique arcade machines. I wonder what keeps Edward Galland Zelinsky (curator + collector) going? There seem to be a million player pianos simultaneously banging out ragtime piano melodies, small vignettes are acted out by cardboard puppet actors in the penny arcade machines, handcrank silent movies, a fat woman who laughs horribly for a nickel and the foreboding gypsy tarot reader that will tell your fortune by dropping you a little printed note. It might seem haunted in a good way, by whatever it is that animates the many machines and keeps them imbued with the spirit of the past. A good place to go on a rainy day, especially on a date.

properties.name: Museum of Jurassic Technology
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers   9341 Venice Boulevard, Culver City, CA 90232 The Museum of Jurassic Technology in Los Angeles, California is an educational institution dedicated to the advancement of knowledge and the public appreciation of the Lower Jurassic. Like a coat of two colors, the Museum serves dual functions. On the one hand the Museum provides the academic community with a specialized repository of relics and artifacts from the Lower Jurassic, with an emphasis on those that demonstrate unusual or curious technological qualities. On the other hand the Museum serves the general public by providing the visitor a hands-on experience of "life in the Jurassic"....

properties.name: Natural History Museum
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers    900 Exposition Boulevard, los angeles, caYes, there are still museums that are like sanctuaries, frozen in time with pockets of space organized by climate and region. Taxidermy animals posed in exhibits, looped recordings of birds and mating calls and bears frozen in mid roar. Now they\'re trying to appeal to a new constituency by bringing in new projects like having musicians like matmos make scores for the exhibits or having jared diamond curate an exhibit based on his book "Collapse."

properties.name: Orange 20 Bikes
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  713 N Heliotrope Rd, Los Angeles, CATwo awesome bike kitchen mechanics have started a new project right across the street. It\'s a bike shop for the urban biker. The kind of bikes that will get you going all-city in style. Bags, helmets, and whatever else you\'d need there too. Great guys who actually ride their bikes everywhere so everything in the store is tested. One of the two guys is a mechanic at Bike magazine so you can rest assured that they carry good stuff.

properties.name: Palomar Observatory in Palomar Mountain State Park
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers Palomar Mountain CA 92060-0200The Palomar Observatory is open to the public from 9:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. daily (except December 24 and 25) for self-guided visits to the 200-inch Telescope. The gallery in the 200-inch dome affords visitors a view of the Hale Telescope. The Palomar Observatory is located in north San Diego County, California. It is a world-class center of astronomical research that is owned and operated by the California Institute of Technology. The observatory is home to five telescopes that are nightly used for a wide variety of astronomical research programs. The research is conducted by Caltech\'s faculty, post-doctoral fellows and students, and by researchers at Caltech\'s collaborating institutions.

properties.name: Pee Wee's Big Adventure Hitchhiking Scene
properties.description: Posted by HundredflowersThe Old Road, Newhall, California, USAPee Wee meets Mickey while hitch hiking here!

properties.name: Pee Wee's Bus Terminal
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers400 W. Cerritos Avenue, Glendale, California, USAThis is where he runs into Simone and wishes her good bye, shortly before fleeing to the rodeo in an attempt to ditch Andy.

properties.name: Pee Wee's House from Pee Wee's Big Adventure  (unconfirmed)
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers 1846 Oxley St. South Pasadena CAPee Wee\'s House from Pee Wee\'s Big Adventure (unconfirmed)

properties.name: Rainer Maria Rilke wrote the poem Autumn Wind here, Sept. 21, 1902
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowersparis, franceLord: it is time. The summer was immense. Lay your shadow on the sundials and let loose the wind in the fields. Bid the last fruits to be full; give them another two more southerly days, press them to ripeness, and chase the last sweetness into the heavy wine. Whoever has no house now will not build one anymore. Whoever is alone now will remain so for a long time, will stay up, read, write long letters, and wander the avenues, up and down, restlessly, while the leaves are blowing.

properties.name: Reuben H. Fleet Science Center
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers1875 El Prado, San Diego, CA 92101Sky Tonight Planetarium Shows at the Reuben H. Fleet Science Center are held the first Wednesday of each month at 7:00 pm.

properties.name: Richard Hugo House (+Zine Archive & Publishing Project)
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  1634 11th Ave. Seattle, WA 98122One summer I drove up to Seattle from Los Angeles on a whim, soft of drifting around and taking things in. I asked a stranger in a radical bookstore to draw me a map of the town (in a platial fashion). He drew a map with directions to some great vegan restaurants, a pirate radio station and also directions to this great resource for writers. The Richard Hugo House is the home of the Zine Archive and Publishing Project, an extensive catalogued zine library. I recognized the librarian when I visited as the girl who wrote a zine about haircuts, specifically bangs. It was great to drift around town and find this great place, where people can attend readings, hold workshops and have access to things like book/zine libraries!

properties.name: Rodeo Scene from Pee Wee - LA County Fairgrounds
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers1101 W. McKinley Avenue, Pomona, California, USAThis is the scene where Pee Wee gets trapped into riding a bucking bronco and loses consciousness. "Do you remember anything?" " . . . I remember . . . the ALAMO!"

properties.name: Rumoured Location of Uncle Eddie's Vegan Cookie Factory
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers 743 Milford Street, glendale, caThere is a rumour that this is the location of the famous Uncle Eddie\'s Vegan Cookie factory! (Someone please go investigate the dumpster!)

properties.name: Salish Lodge AKA Exterior of Great Northern in Twin Peaks
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers6501 Railroad Avenue SE, Snoqualmie, WA"Twenty-four hour room service must be one of the premier achievements of modern civilization" FBI Special Agent Dale Cooper This is the filming location of the exterior of the Great Northern, where Dale Cooper stays.

properties.name: Santa Barbara Hobby Central (models - trains, planes, etc)
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers14 W Anapamu St, santa barbara, caI loved this place when I was in art school. Model trains, planes, cars and lots of balsa wood kits too. I loved to buy the scale model people and trees for placement in unexpected places. I never knew how many things you could readily buy in tiny size. Once I built a model Kentucky Fried Chicken kit and assembled it in one of the art dept. faculty mailboxes.

properties.name: Santa Monica College Planetarium
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers1900 Pico Boulevard, Santa Monica California 90405Santa Monica College is the home of a new, state-of-the-art, computerized planetarium theater. At its heart is the Evans & Sutherland Digistar II planetarium projector, the first of its kind on the West Coast. Using digital technology, audiences can fly beyond the solar system and soar among the stars. The Planetarium is open to the public every Friday nights with public planetarium shows designed for the whole family. The Planetarium is located in the middle of the second floor of Drescher Hall (formerly known as the Technology Building) on the north side of the Santa Monica College campus. Click here for a map of our campus. Drescher Hall is the four story tall green, blue, and white building on the SouthEast corner of Pico Blvd. and 17th Street.

properties.name: Scene where Harris is riding a stationary bike in LA Story
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  glendale blvd and park ave, los angeles, ca"I have a favorite quote about LA by William Shakespeare. He said \'this other eden, demi-paradise, this precious stone set in the silver sea, this earth, this realm, this Los Angeles.\'" Harris K Telemacher Echo Park is the location of one of the first scenes in Steve Martin\'s LA story. You see Harris Telemacher (Steve\'s character) riding a stationary bike next to the lotuses in Echo Park Lake. The "stationary bike riding park" was created for the movie, so you won\'t find it there if you go now.

properties.name: Scoops Gelato / Antai Gallery
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  712 N. Heliotrope Drive Los Angeles, CA Gelato from heaven. The owner of this gelato boutique makes each gourmet batch by hand. Here you\'ll find mind blowing flavors like white-chocolate-wasabi rubbing elbows with old and delicious standbys like pistachio. You must go here!

properties.name: Silverlake Farmers Market
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  West Sunset Blvd & Edgecliffe Drive, los angeles, caSaturday, 8:00 AM to 1:00 PM. Ride your bike, there\'s not much parking!

properties.name: Skylight books
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers1818 N. Vermont Avenue, los angelesIndependent bookstore. Great in store events, nice magazine selection. 8 out of 10 times they have what I want. A cat with no tail lives there, very nice. The people who work there, very nice. Best part is their comic section--I usually go there to get the new indy comic releases.

properties.name: South Central Community Farm
properties.description: Posted by HundredflowersE 41st St & S Alameda St, Los Angeles, CA 90058A vibrant community farm in danger of being evicted! "Synopsis of the history of the 14-acre urban garden located at 41st and Alameda Streets Since 1992, the 14 acres of property located at 41st and Alameda Streets in Los Angeles have been used as a community garden or farm. The land has been divided into 360 plots and is believed to be one of the largest urban gardens in the country. The City of Los Angeles acquired the 14-acre property by eminent domain in the late 1980s, taking it from nine private landowners. The largest of these owners, Alameda-Barbara Investment Company (â€œAlamedaâ€), owned approximately 80 percent of the site. The partners of Alameda were Ralph Horowitz and Jacob Libaw. The City originally intended to use the property for a trash incinerator, but abandoned that plan in the face of public protest organized by Juanita Tate and the Concerned Citizens of South Central Los Angeles. As part of the eminent domain proceedings, the City granted Alameda a right of first refusal if, within 10 years, the City determined that the parcel formerly owned by Alameda was no longer required for public use. Following the uprising in 1992, the City set aside the 14-acre site for use as a community garden. In 1994, the City transferred title to the property by ordinance to its Harbor Department. When it received title to the property, the Harbor Department contracted with the Los Angeles Regional Foodbank to operate the property as a community garden; the Foodbank has been operating it as such since then." For the full story on why farming families are in danger of eviction, visit the website and join them in their struggle to preserve this community resource.

properties.name: Southern California Library for Social Justice and Research
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers    6120 South Vermont Avenue, los angeles, caOur Mission The Southern California Library is a vital community resource in the heart of Los Angeles dedicated to education for social change. The Library offers unique and accessible collections and programs on Southern California\'s social and progressive history. We engage people across generations in using history to advance social justice.

properties.name: Taco Zone
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers 1342 N Alvarado St. Los Angeles, CA 90026Regular late night taco truck that pulls up in front of the Von\'s on Alvarado. Like any taco truck it has been through its ups and downs. I like to get the veggie burritos here.

properties.name: Tail O' the Pup
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers329 N San Vicente Blvd, West Hollywood, CAAn LA landmark! The signature hot dog shaped stand has been used in tons of movies. Unfortunately it was forced to close earlier this year to make way for some new condos!

properties.name: The Smell
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers   247 S Main St, Los Angeles, CAThe Smell is an all ages music venue happening in Downtown Los Angeles, California. It is a volunteer-run space with no employees or profit of any kind. On almost any night of the week one can come to The Smell and be part of an intimate performance by local and touring musicians. Most shows cost five dollars. Although there is a proper stage with adequate sound system and lighting, bands choose to play all over the club - from behind the stage to the front desk, from the bathroom to the parking lot. Aside it\'s primary function as a live music and performance art space. Enter through the alley.

properties.name: Third Street Promenade (Where Pee Wee's Bike is Stolen)
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  1222 Third Street Promenade, santa monica, caThis is the scene were Pee Wee chains his bike to an animated clown so that he can pick up some magic supplies and pick up his new bike horn from Dottie at Chuck\'s Bike Shop. The promenade no longer looks anything like this. Now you\'ll find a ton of bad guitar strumming street performers and stores like J Crew, Diesel and Urban Outfitters.

properties.name: Travel Town Museum
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers    5200 Zoo Dr, los angeles, caAn amazing outdoor museum with a collection of old locomotives, train cars, cabooses, trolley cars and a "miniature smoker" that kids can take a ride on. You might recognize the miniature train from the movie "The Jerk" where Steve Martin\'s character acts as the conductor. A really nice place to go and wander around. You can really feel the history as you climb in and out of the different train cars.

properties.name: Turn Hall (1915)* Emma Goldman Arrested
properties.description: Posted by Jason    SW 4th & Yamhill, portland, orOn August 7, 1915, Emma Goldman and her partner Ben Rietman were arrested for distributing birth control information, a violation of the Comstock Law. Emma was preparing to speak, having been introduced by C.E.S. Wood, when she was arrested by a plain clothes policeman and taken downtown. Wood bailed her out but she and Rietman received 00 fines. Emma spoke two more times in Portland, once against World War II, and the other time against monogamy.

properties.name: Twede's Cafe AKA Double R Diner from Twin Peaks
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  137 W North Bend Way, North Bend, WA 98045"This must be where pies go when they die." FBI Agent Dale Cooper in Twin Peaks Located in the Snoqualmie Valley in North Bend, Wa this diner was featured in Twin Peaks as the Double R Diner.

properties.name: Vegan Star Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  751 North Virgil Avenue, los angeles, caFrom the lady that brought you Vegan Express--it\'s a new vegan restaurant that features a sunday brunch!

properties.name: Wall Drug
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers510 Main Street, Wall, SD 57790It\'s famous. Maybe you know it through the many bumper stickers around the world or maybe you\'re lucky to have visited during a cross country road trip.

properties.name: Warner Backlot (Pee Wee is re-united with his bike at last!)
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers 4000 Warner Blvd, Burbank. CAThis is where Pee-Wee dons a nun outfit to get closer to his bike, ultimately re-claiming it and riding through a montage of classic "movie studio" scenarios.

properties.name: Wheel Inn Restaurant (Tell them Large Marge sent ya!) Pee Wee's Big Adventure
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  50900 Seminole Drive, Cabazon, California, USAAlso a filming location for Paris, Texas. This is the infamous diner where a beleaguered Pee Wee gets dropped off by Large Marge in Pee Wee\'s Big Adventure. Good thing Simone is there to befriend him. I went there and had a milkshake and tuna platter in his honor but it made me sort of sick. The waitresses that work there now have to wear cave woman outfits.

properties.name: Wilshire Mariposa Farmers Market
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  South Mariposa Avenue & Wilshire Blvd, los angeles, caFriday, 11:30 AM to 3:00 PM. Easy to take the red line there.
